data.question: What is the optimum band gap range for single-junction solar cells as determined by Shockley and Queisser?
What is the main impediment for tin-containing perovskite performance?
data.answer: The facile oxidation of Sn(II) to Sn(IV)

data.question: What effect does maltol post-treatment have on mixed Pb–Sn perovskite films?
data.answer: It suppresses Sn(II) oxidation and reduces the density of defects at the perovskite film surface.

data.question: What is the power conversion efficiency of lead-based perovskite solar cells?
True or False: The addition of Sn(0) powder into the Sn-containing precursor solution reduces Sn(II) vacancies in the resulting perovskite films.
What is the charge carrier lifetime of perovskite films treated with both TM-DHP reductant and maltol post-treatment?
True or False: The band gaps of mixed lead–tin (Pb–Sn) perovskite absorbers fall outside the optimal range for solar cell performance.
What is the photoconversion efficiency of solar cell devices treated with both TM-DHP reductant and maltol post-treatment under AM1.5G illumination?
True or False: Maltol is a naturally occurring flavor enhancer and strong metal binding agent.
What is the effect of oxygen levels as low as a few ppm on Sn(II) in perovskite films?
data.answer: It causes Sn(II) to oxidize, creating Sn(II) vacancies which lead to an increase in hole density.

data.question: True or False: The performance of solar cells fabricated with Pb–Sn perovskites is not restricted by the oxidation of Sn(II) to Sn(IV).
What is the role of SnF2 in the preparation of perovskite films?
data.answer: It is known to suppress the oxidation of Sn(II) at the precursor preparation stage.

data.question: True or False: The addition of Pb(SCN)2 to the perovskite precursor solution is to mediate the perovskite crystal growth.
What is the impact of TM-DHP treatment on the crystallinity of perovskite films?
data.answer: It improves crystallinity, as indicated by the stronger intensities of the peaks at 14.5° and 28.8°, indexed to (100) and (200) planes of the perovskite, respectively.

data.question: True or False: The maltol post-treatment does not affect the photoluminescence intensity of perovskite films.
What is the estimated carrier diffusion length using the PL lifetime of 7.4 ms for treated perovskite films?
True or False: The ideality factor of perovskite solar cells treated with both TM-DHP and maltol is higher than those treated with TM-DHP only.
What is the trap-filled limit voltage (VTFL) for the perovskite films in the hole-only devices treated with TM-DHP and maltol?
True or False: The maltol treatment leads to suppressed Sn(IV) content, decreased defect densities, and prolonged charge carrier lifetimes in perovskite films.
True or False: The power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the champion solar cell fabricated with the combination of Sn(IV) scavenging and maltol post-treatment was below 20%.
